intro: Amethystanthus excisus f. albiflorus, commonly known as the white-flowered amethyst anthus, is a rare and striking plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique, amethyst-colored flowers with a distinctive white bloom in the center. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery coating, enhancing its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by specialty growers.
